articles.author: Timour Azhari, Ari Rabinovitch
articles.description: Israel bombed central Beirut in the early hours of Thursday, killing at least six people, after its forces suffered their deadliest day on the Lebanese front in a year of clashes against Iran-backed armed group Hezbollah.
articles.title: Israel strikes heart of Beirut, killing six

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Russian forces launched a major drone attack overnight on 15 Ukrainian regions, causing damage to commercial and residential buildings, local authorities said on Thursday, though there were no immediate reports of any casualties.
articles.title: Russia launches major drone attack on Ukraine, damages residential buildings

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Ghana's health service has reported the country's first case of mpox this year, without disclosing which variant had been recorded, according to a statement.
articles.title: Ghana reports first mpox case but variant not yet clear

articles.author: Andrew Goudsward
articles.description: Donald Trump on Thursday urged a federal judge to toss out two obstruction charges central to the case that the former U.S. president illegally sought to overturn his 2020 election defeat, citing a recent U.S. Supreme Court ruling raising the legal bar for those offenses.
articles.title: Trump moves to toss Jan. 6 obstruction charges, citing Supreme Court ruling

articles.author: Renee Maltezou, Jonathan Saul
articles.description: On a warm spring night in Athens, shortly before midnight, a senior executive at a Greek shipping company noticed an unusual email had landed in his personal inbox.
articles.title: Houthis warn shipowners in new phase of Red Sea campaign: Prepare to be attacked

articles.author: David Morgan
articles.description: Eight U.S. states are asking to ban noncitizens from voting even though it is already illegal, and critics say it is part of a plan by Donald Trump and his Republican allies to challenge the presidential election result if he loses again on Nov. 5.
articles.title: Eight US states to vote on amendments to ban noncitizen voters

articles.author: Alistair Smout, Michael Holden, Villen Anganan
articles.description: Britain said on Thursday it would cede sovereignty of the Chagos Islands to Mauritius in a deal it said secured the future of the UK-U.S. Diego Garcia military base, and which could also pave the way for people displaced decades ago to return home.
articles.title: UK cedes Chagos Island sovereignty to Mauritius, retains Diego Garcia airbase

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: One in six children in Haiti is facing emergency food insecurity, just one step away from famine, according to a report from charity Save the Children published on Thursday.
articles.title: Haiti conflict pushes 17% of children close to famine, charity says

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: An Israeli strike on Beirut targeted senior Hezbollah official Hashem Safieddine, Axios reporter Barak Ravid said in a post on social media platform X early on Friday, citing an Israeli source.
articles.title: Israeli strike on Beirut targets senior Hezbollah official Hashem Safieddine, Axios reporter says

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Mexico's Supreme Court agreed on Thursday to consider a constitutional challenge to the controversial judicial overhaul enacted last month that will move the country over the next few years to a system of popularly elected judges.
articles.title: Mexico's top court accepts constitutional challenge to judicial overhaul
